result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J Jesion

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David J Jesion appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke appeared by video for David J Jesion.  Attorney Careen Marie Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's witness is present. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 09, Judge Van Grunsven. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 09. Scheduling conference scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David J Jesion appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Lamke is unable to appear due to having Intake. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David J Jesion in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-27-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant David J Jesion in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/25/22 @ 1:30p
